channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [LOG4J2-560] TLSSyslogAppenderTest is failing in trunk with Java 8 (build 1.8.0-b128)
item.description:
All four tests in TLSSyslogAppenderTest are failing with basically the same problem:

ERROR StatusLogger The keystore file(src/test/resources/org/apache/logging/log4j/core/net/ssl/client.log4j2-keystore.jks) is not found
ERROR StatusLogger The keystore file(src/test/resources/org/apache/logging/log4j/core/net/ssl/truststore.jks) is not found
item.environment:
Maven, IntelliJ, Java 8 (build 1.8.0-b128)

Apache Maven 3.2.1 (ea8b2b07643dbb1b84b6d16e1f08391b666bc1e9; 2014-02-14T12:37:52-05:00)
Maven home: C:\Java\apache-maven-3.2.1\bin\..
Java version: 1.8.0, vendor: Oracle Corporation
Java home: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0\jre
Default locale: en_US, platform encoding: Cp1252
OS name: "windows 7", version: "6.1", arch: "amd64", family: "dos"

java version "1.8.0"
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.8.0-b128)
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 25.0-b69, mixed mode)
item.summary: TLSSyslogAppenderTest is failing in trunk with Java 8 (build 1.8.0-b128)

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Hah, false alarm on that. Here's what I actually get from Maven:

Failed tests:
SyslogAppenderTest.testUDPStructuredAppender:85->SyslogAppenderTestBase.sendAndCheckStructuredMessage:88->SyslogAppenderTestBase.checkTheEqualityOfSentAndReceivedMessages:117 Incorrect message received: <134>1 2014-03-03T17:45:18.579-06:00 MACDF1G3 TestApp - Audit [RequestContext@18060 ipAddress="192.168.0.120" loginId="JohnDoe"][Transfer@18060 Amount="200.00" FromAccount="123457" ToAccount="123456"] Transfer Complete

SyslogAppenderTest.testTCPStructuredAppender:69->SyslogAppenderTestBase.sendAndCheckStructuredMessage:88->SyslogAppenderTestBase.checkTheEqualityOfSentAndReceivedMessages:117 Incorrect message received: <134>1 2014-03-03T17:45:18.827-06:00 MACDF1G3 TestApp - Audit [RequestContext@18060 ipAddress="192.168.0.120" loginId="JohnDoe"][Transfer@18060 Amount="200.00" FromAccount="123457" ToAccount="123456"] Transfer Complete

TLSSyslogAppenderTest.sendStructuredMessagesOverTLS:73->SyslogAppenderTestBase.sendAndCheckStructuredMessages:82->SyslogAppenderTestBase.checkTheEqualityOfSentAndReceivedMessages:117 Incorrect message received: <134>1 2014-03-03T17:45:20.591-06:00 MACDF1G3 TestApp - Audit [RequestContext@18060 ipAddress="192.168.0.120" loginId="JohnDoe"][Transfer@18060 Amount="200.00" FromAccount="123457" ToAccount="123456"] Transfer Complete

TLSSyslogAppenderTest.sendStructuredMessageOverTLS:65->SyslogAppenderTestBase.sendAndCheckStructuredMessage:88->SyslogAppenderTestBase.checkTheEqualityOfSentAndReceivedMessages:117 Incorrect message received: <134>1 2014-03-03T17:45:20.958-06:00 MACDF1G3 TestApp - Audit [RequestContext@18060 ipAddress="192.168.0.120" loginId="JohnDoe"][Transfer@18060 Amount="200.00" FromAccount="123457" ToAccount="123456"] Transfer Complete

TLSSyslogAppenderTest>SyslogAppenderTest.testUDPStructuredAppender:85->SyslogAppenderTestBase.sendAndCheckStructuredMessage:88->SyslogAppenderTestBase.checkTheEqualityOfSentAndReceivedMessages:117 Incorrect message received: <134>1 2014-03-03T17:45:22.921-06:00 MACDF1G3 TestApp - Audit [RequestContext@18060 ipAddress="192.168.0.120" loginId="JohnDoe"][Transfer@18060 Amount="200.00" FromAccount="123457" ToAccount="123456"] Transfer Complete

TLSSyslogAppenderTest>SyslogAppenderTest.testTCPStructuredAppender:69->SyslogAppenderTestBase.sendAndCheckStructuredMessage:88->SyslogAppenderTestBase.checkTheEqualityOfSentAndReceivedMessages:117 Incorrect message received: <134>1 2014-03-03T17:45:23.136-06:00 MACDF1G3 TestApp - Audit [RequestContext@18060 ipAddress="192.168.0.120" loginId="JohnDoe"][Transfer@18060 Amount="200.00" FromAccount="123457" ToAccount="123456"] Transfer Complete

RFC5424LayoutTest.testLoggerFields:334 Not expected message received
These tests all work fine for me on OSX. I assume you are having these problems on Windows? What JDK are you using?

This is a problem only on Java 8:

Apache Maven 3.2.1 (ea8b2b07643dbb1b84b6d16e1f08391b666bc1e9; 2014-02-14T12:37:52-05:00)
Maven home: C:\Java\apache-maven-3.2.1\bin\..
Java version: 1.8.0, vendor: Oracle Corporation
Java home: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0\jre
Default locale: en_US, platform encoding: Cp1252
OS name: "windows 7", version: "6.1", arch: "amd64", family: "dos"

java version "1.8.0"
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.8.0-b128)
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 25.0-b69, mixed mode)

I'm on OSX. Just noticed that I'm also using Java 1.8. So I guess it really is related to Java 8.

mvn -version
Apache Maven 3.2.1 (ea8b2b07643dbb1b84b6d16e1f08391b666bc1e9; 2014-02-14T11:37:52-06:00)
Maven home: /usr/local/Cellar/maven/3.2.1/libexec
Java version: 1.8.0, vendor: Oracle Corporation
Java home: /Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk1.8.0.jdk/Contents/Home/jre
Default locale: en_US, platform encoding: UTF-8
OS name: "mac os x", version: "10.8.5", arch: "x86_64", family: "mac"

java -version
java version "1.8.0"
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.8.0-b129)
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 25.0-b69, mixed mode)
I installed Java 8 and am seeing the same failures. Since builds using Java 6 work fine I don't believe other fixes, such as upgrading the SLF4J version, are suspect.
It appears that for some reason the order of how the Structured Data elements are being written has changed. I'll have to look some more to figure out why.
Fixed in revision 1574267. Please verify and close.
Verified working in my Java 8 environment now.
